intro: Palaquium celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes starfruit, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The tree produces edible, star-shaped fruits that are typically harvested when they are fully mature. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
